Legal_Issue: Whether the plaintiffs' claims of unfair treatment, reliance on ministerial representations, and discriminatory reassessments disclose a reasonable cause of action
Burden_of_Proof: Plaintiffs failed to disclose a reasonable cause of action
Legal_Rule: Under Rule 419(1)(a) of the Canadian Income Tax Act, pleadings must disclose a reasonable cause of action; the Minister can reassess within statutory limits and is not bound by prior assessments or policies inconsistent with the Act
Procedural_Issue: Striking paragraphs from the statement of claim for failure to disclose a reasonable cause of action
Grounds_for_Claim: Unfair treatment, reliance on ministerial representations, discriminatory reassessments
Outcome_on_Merits: Claims dismissed due to lack of reasonable cause of action
Judicial_Review_Outcome: No judicial review available outside statutory remedies
Review_Standard: Statutory interpretation of the Income Tax Act
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Minister not required to follow internal policies inconsistent with the Act
Key_Evidence_Considered: Prior assessments, ministerial policies, interest expense deductions
Applicant_Challenge: Challenging the Minister's reassessment of interest expense deductions
Standard_of_Proof: Pleading standard â€“ reasonable cause of action
Defendant_Response: Minister not bound by prior assessments or internal policies
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence of assessments and tax filings
Remedy_Requested: Judicial intervention to overturn reassessments based on fairness and discrimination
Remedy_Sought: Invalidation of reassessments and restoration of claimed deductions
Legal_Provision: Rule 419(1)(a) of the Canadian Income Tax Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Failure to disclose a reasonable cause of action
Applicable_Process: Pre-trial motion under civil procedure rules
Outcome_of_Review: No remedy available outside statutory framework
Governing_Rule: Rule 419(1)(a) of the Canadian Income Tax Act
